channel.title: Comments on: RETRO: Talking Heads “The Great Curve” live in Rome 1980

item.title: By: Creedance
item.dc:creator: Creedance
item.description: Never mind. Dec. 18, 1980, live at Palaeur Arena, Rome. Thanks anyway
item.content:encoded: Never mind. Dec. 18, 1980, live at Palaeur Arena, Rome. Thanks anyway

item.title: By: Creedance
item.dc:creator: Creedance
item.description: I've been told that this show was on December 1980. Does anybody know the exact date?
item.content:encoded: I’ve been told that this show was on December 1980. Does anybody know the exact date?

item.title: By: Rob
item.dc:creator: Rob
item.description:
There are a total of 9 live songs from this live show. It's an expanded Heads lineup with an extra bass player, percussion, vocals and an incredibly good performance from Adrian Belew (King Crimson) on guitar.
This is Remain In Light vintage Heads, and the good stuff gets a great working out.
All 11 tracks are on YouTube. You can even find the torrent if you want the whole show. The quality is as good as you can expect from a VHS copy of a TV show.
This show illustrates just how good Talking Heads were, and the brilliance of the core band. Tina Weymouth looks scrumptious, and David Byrne is at his manic best.
I can't tell you how good this stuff is. Would have to rate as one of the best live shows ever, by any band.
item.content:encoded:
There are a total of 9 live songs from this live show. It’s an expanded Heads lineup with an extra bass player, percussion, vocals and an incredibly good performance from Adrian Belew (King Crimson) on guitar.

This is Remain In Light vintage Heads, and the good stuff gets a great working out.

All 11 tracks are on YouTube. You can even find the torrent if you want the whole show. The quality is as good as you can expect from a VHS copy of a TV show.

This show illustrates just how good Talking Heads were, and the brilliance of the core band. Tina Weymouth looks scrumptious, and David Byrne is at his manic best.

I can’t tell you how good this stuff is. Would have to rate as one of the best live shows ever, by any band.
